etymology.description: Semantic 宀(宀) (mián, "roof") + Semantic 口(口) (kǒu, "mouth") + Phonetic 丯(丯) = a structure covering a vocal element, suggesting confinement or restriction -> harm
etymology.interpretation: The character 害(hài) consists of a roof 宀(宀), representing a covered or enclosed space, combined with 口(口), indicating concepts related to speech or mouth. The phonetic 丯 helps to articulate the sound. Together, the character conveys the idea of harm as being restricted or constrained, perhaps metaphorically linked to being silenced or confined under the roof.

examples.chinese: 虚假的信息会害人(虛假的信息會害人)。
examples.pinyin: xūjiǎ de xìnxī huì hài rén.

examples.chinese: 谣言散播(謠言散播)，必然会害到社会(必然會害到社會)。
examples.pinyin: yáoyán sànbō, bìrán huì hài dào shèhuì.
examples.english: Spreading rumors will certainly harm society.

examples.chinese: 一时的愤怒会害自己(一時的憤怒會害自己)，招来麻烦(招來麻煩)。
examples.pinyin: yīshí de fènnù huì hài zìjǐ, zhāo lái máfan.
examples.english: A moment of anger will harm oneself and invite trouble.
